Remember, don't give up, trust God, search for answers.

He's the one that God told me. And then that lands, he ends up in jail and he's, he's having doubts.
And so he sends his disciples to Jesus saying, so are you the actual one or should we be waiting
for someone else? Yep. And I can picture John's kind of like, this is not how I saw this ending.
Yep. And so Jesus doesn't reprimand him. He doesn't go, what are you thinking? How could you doubt
you're supposed to be my wingman or whatever it is. This is the guy who leapt in his mother's womb
when he met Jesus, right? Jesus then appeals to evidence. He goes, go back and ask John. So what
have you seen? What evidence is there? And so, you know, the, the, you know, blind or seeing the
lamer walk, all those things. And then he turns to the audience, to the people around him and starts
talking about John, what did you expect to see of things? But then he compliments John in the
greatest way possible. So again, Jesus isn't scared of our questions and it's not, you don't ever see
that the, the teaching or the implication in scripturally don't come to God with your doubts.
Don't come to him with your questions. We talked about Thomas last time, who was just honest.
Yep. You know, so I think of twice Paul does this once with Thessalonians and the Thessalonians
are for the Thessalonians. And then I'm not sure off top of my head where the other one is.
But when he's talking to Thessalonians and he's saying, don't despise prophecies. In other words,
don't throw them away automatically, right? But test everything, hold fast to what is good.
And that that's, by the way, that the Greek word there test that's documos.
And so to this, that's the root of it anyway, but the test it don't, this is, this is what the story
right before I told it that I was referencing in, I think the Berean churches right before the
Athens church. It's very soon before that. When it talks about the, it's a church that Paul comes
and preaches and he teaches and when he gets done, they all go, all right, we'll go home and check.
And so they go gather and they get copies of the apparently of the scriptures and they test
everything Paul says and they're honored. This isn't what's our, what's amazing to me is how often
people walk away from Christian teaching saying, you know, somehow doubt is a lack of faith or
doubt is sin or doubt is, and I'm like, I'm like, here, here's my Bible. Show me. Find me an example
of that with, especially in the new Testament, find me any example that you could even twist to say
that. And I just don't think it's there. So our faith is not dependent on our knowledge. That would
be Gnosticism. Our faith is a, is a gift that we can have and we can reasonably, evidentially,
that's a real word or not, we'll go with it. And we can believe, we can accept and we can believe
based on that. Thank you for joining us for this episode of reconstructed faith.
If you enjoyed what you heard or were challenged, please leave us a review. We'll help other people
find us. If you have questions or a topic you'd like to hear discussed, shoot me an email at info
at southspring.org. Reconstructed faith is a resource of South Spring Baptist Church.
Remember, don't give up, trust God, search for answers.
